body: Maybe having a syncinclude file with syncignore would help, that way the user would be able to add everything to syncignore and the desired files to syncinclude. That also would simulate sync Android's behavior.

@stooone That's not really priority as much as a filter. I assume @jpjp actually wants all those files, just that he's a bit impatient about the order. :)

That said, you can actually do that (only sync specified parts of a repo) as of 0.9.11 (next version) with the exclude patterns in .stignore (https://discourse.syncthing.net/t/excluding-files-from-synchronization-ignoring/80/5):

```
!wantedFile
**
```

That will ignore everything in the repo except `wantedFile`.
Oh nice I didn't knew that .stignore covers this use case! Great!

issue.title: Selective download

labels.name: frozen-due-to-age
labels.description: Issues closed and untouched for a long time, together with being locked for discussion

issue.body:
I have a big music repository that I want to be available on many client machines. Problem is - I dont have anough space there to download the whole folder.

Would it be possible to only sync the index to the other clients and select only those files I want on the client to be downloaded and synced? Bittorrent sync got this feature in thier android-app - its a pretty nice idea..
Maybe it can be somehow merged with  #629.

Regards, Schuft

issue.title: Transfer small files with higher priority

labels.name: frozen-due-to-age
labels.description: Issues closed and untouched for a long time, together with being locked for discussion

issue.body: Currently if Syncthing is transferring a big file and small files are added the user has to wait for the big file to finish. It would be great if transfer of big file is paused and small(er) files are sent first. Also if all files are new to the destination device files could be transferred in ascending size order.

body:
I was wondering about this.
Can we have a queue where you can bump up and down your individual files, or is the memory footprint potentially to big?

Surely if it's just file names + perhaps pointers, it couldn't be too big?
In the grand scheme of things, probably not significant. We already do this as part of the ignore cache, as soon as you have an ignore file, after all.

issue.title: Fix the "out of sync items" modal

labels.name: enhancement
labels.description: New features or improvements of some kind, as opposed to a problem (bug)

labels.name: good first issue
labels.description: Good starting points for new contributors

labels.name: frozen-due-to-age
labels.description: Issues closed and untouched for a long time, together with being locked for discussion

issue.body:
- It shouldn't be much longer than the screen. Scroll instead.
- Long filenames shouldn't screw it up.
- It should be keyboard closable. (#508, #498)

body: I noticed this in the source code, but I have never seen it in action. What needs to happen so that this feature becomes active?
there is now a arrow in the needed file list which allows bumping a file.

That would be great, but somehow this arrow is never visible. I click on "out of sync (x items ~ x GB)" -> "needed files modal" opens (with list of items and progress bars in red, green, orange, etc.). I see the button in index.html but during runtime browser (and also firebug) does not show the line "<span ng-if="$index != 0"...." as active

Can you post a screenshot as I am not clear exactly.

If there are only two files, you won't see the arrow, because the first one is already in progress, and the second one has been taken off the queue, ready to go next, hence you can only reorder from the 3rd file onwards.

If you have more copier routines then it will be from N+2 onwards where N is the number of copier routines (defaults is 1 though).

> If there are only two files, you won't see the arrow ok, noted (this was the case) - after adding more files the button was displayed correctly. Would you be so kind and change the `` to `` because currently the icon is only text and does not indicate that you can click it. Also a `title="{{'Move to top of queue' | translate}}"` attribute would help usability. Thanks!

Please open a separate issue, as this will get lost forever. 
Also to be honest, you could make a pull request, given you know how to do it.
